segments.en: Numbered Discourses 7
4. Deities
35. Easy to Admonish (2nd)

segments.pli: “Imaṃ, bhikkhave, rattiṃ aññatarā devatā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā … pe …
segments.en: “Mendicants, tonight a deity … said to me:
‘Sir, these seven things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.
What seven?

segments.pli: Satthugāravatā, dhammagāravatā, saṅghagāravatā, sikkhāgāravatā, samādhigāravatā, sovacassatā, kalyāṇamittatā.
segments.en: Respect for the Teacher, for the teaching, for the Saṅgha, for the training, for immersion; being easy to admonish, and good friendship.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhante, satta dhammā bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattantī’ti.
segments.en: These seven things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.’
That is what that deity said.

segments.pli: Idaṃ vatvā maṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā tatthevantaradhāyī”ti.
segments.en: Then he bowed and respectfully circled me, keeping me on his right side, before vanishing right there.”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, āyasmā sāriputto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When he said this, Venerable Sāriputta said to the Buddha:

segments.pli: “imassa kho ahaṃ, bhante, bhagavatā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa evaṃ vitthārena atthaṃ ājānāmi.
segments.en: “Sir, this is how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.

segments.pli: Idha, bhante, bhikkhu attanā ca satthugāravo hoti, satthugāravatāya ca vaṇṇavādī.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant personally respects the Teacher and praises such respect.

segments.pli: Ye caññe bhikkhū na satthugāravā te ca satthugāravatāya samādapeti.
segments.en: And they encourage other mendicants who lack such respect to respect the Teacher.

segments.pli: Ye caññe bhikkhū satthugāravā tesañca vaṇṇaṃ bhaṇati bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena.
segments.en: And they praise other mendicants who respect the Teacher at the right time, truthfully and substantively.
They personally respect the teaching …
They personally respect the Saṅgha …
They personally respect the training …
They personally respect immersion …
They are personally easy to admonish …
They personally have good friends, and praise such friendship.

segments.pli: Ye caññe bhikkhū na kalyāṇamittā te ca kalyāṇamittatāya samādapeti.
segments.en: And they encourage other mendicants who lack good friends to develop good friendship.

segments.pli: Ye caññe bhikkhū kalyāṇamittā tesañca vaṇṇaṃ bhaṇati bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālenāti.
segments.en: And they praise other mendicants who have good friends at the right time, truthfully and substantively.

segments.pli: Imassa kho ahaṃ, bhante, bhagavatā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa evaṃ vitthārena atthaṃ ājānāmī”ti.
segments.en: That’s how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.”
“Good, good, Sāriputta!

segments.pli: Sādhu kho tvaṃ, sāriputta, imassa mayā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa evaṃ vitthārena atthaṃ ājānāsi.
segments.en: It’s good that you understand the detailed meaning of what I’ve said in brief like this.

segments.pli: Idha, sāriputta, bhikkhu attanā ca satthugāravo hoti, satthugāravatāya ca vaṇṇavādī.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant personally respects the Teacher …

segments.pli: Ye caññe bhikkhū na satthugāravā te ca satthugāravatāya samādapeti.
segments.en: And they encourage other mendicants who lack such respect to respect the Teacher.

segments.pli: Ye caññe bhikkhū satthugāravā tesañca vaṇṇaṃ bhaṇati bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena.
segments.en: And they praise other mendicants who respect the Teacher at the right time, truthfully and substantively.
They personally respect the teaching …
They personally respect the Saṅgha …
They personally respect the training …
They personally respect immersion …
They are personally easy to admonish …
They personally have good friends, and praise such friendship.

segments.pli: Ye caññe bhikkhū na kalyāṇamittā te ca kalyāṇamittatāya samādapeti.
segments.en: And they encourage other mendicants who lack good friends to develop good friendship.

segments.pli: Ye caññe bhikkhū kalyāṇamittā tesañca vaṇṇaṃ bhaṇati bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālenāti.
segments.en: And they praise other mendicants who have good friends at the right time, truthfully and substantively.

segments.pli: Imassa kho, sāriputta, mayā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa evaṃ vitthārena attho daṭṭhabbo”ti.
segments.en: This is how to understand the detailed meaning of what I said in brief.”

sections.title: “Mendicants, tonight a deity … said to me:

suttaplex.blurb: The Buddha tells of hearing the seven principles of non-decline from a god. Sāriputta offers additional explanation.
